column4: any information on how to enable cpu scaling in dapper drake?
depends.  what processor?
celeron M
ahahahahahaha.  use the module p4_clockmod.  then you need either cpufreqd or powernowd.  i like powernowd, personally.  clocks it down when not being taxed, clocks it up when it needs more power.
no, it might already be loaded.  `lsmod | grep clockmod`
so i run lsmod | grep clockmod in terminal then install powernowd?
well, doing the lsmod will tell you if p4_clockmod is loaded if it is, you can install powernowd, and it should start working.
i got now message what so ever
ok, so `sudo modprobe p4_clockmod`
and you'll want to add it to /etc/modules
well, it shouldn't give any feedback.  do the lmod thing again.  it should show it now.
do i have to reboot in order for the speed stepping to kick in?
nope
there's a cpufreq applet for gnome, i think
yeah ive enabled that applet
well, is powernowd running?  you may need to `sudo /etc/init.d/powernowd start`
: ok thanks
make sure to check out powernowd --help to see a few settings.  you may want to play with it a bit
hah, that's nothing.  125 mhz :-P
`sudo modprobe p4_clockmod` .  also, add that to /etc/modules
how do i auto enable cpu freq scaling on boot?
